citeinfo.origin: Spatial Analysis Center, Yellowstone National Park
citeinfo.title: gye_allroads

descript.abstract: This dataset contains all the road centerlines in the Greater Yellowstone Area (GYA). The data were created from the 1:100,000 Digital Line Graph (DLG) datasets from the USGS.
descript.purpose: This dataset will provide a uniform, seamless road centerline network to the extent of the GYA.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

place.placekey: Yellowstone National Park, YNP, YELL, Greater Yellowstone Area, GYA, Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem, GYE, Park County, Teton County, Fremont County, Gallatin County, Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Northern Rocky Mountains
National Park Service, NPS, Department of the Interior, DOI, US Government
United States of America, US, USA, North America

idinfo.accconst: None - the source data are USGS DLG's, which are in the public domain.
idinfo.useconst: These data should be used in a manner consistent with its accuracy and precision. No claims are made for uses at scales larger than its publication scale.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

attracc.attraccr: Accuracy of length attributes is unknown. Refer to DLG Intermediate scale documentation: http://edc.usgs.gov/glis/hyper/guide/usgs_dlg.

dataqual.logic: Full line topology exists for this layer as verified by Arc/info v8. The coverage has not been edited since the last BUILD function.
dataqual.complete: This layer, in reality, represents a fraction of all roads in the GYA. It leaves out many secondary highways, connecting highways, and local roads.

horizpa.horizpar: Approximate horizontal accuracy is 51 meters, assuming source data meets National Map Accuracy Standards.

citeinfo.title: 1:100,000 Digital Line Graphs
citeinfo.othercit: DLGs were created from 1987 to present.

srcinfo.srccontr: The transportation data from each DLG dataset were converted to ARC/INFO coverages using the SDTS2COV.AML. All quad tiles were then appended into one coverage for each theme: roads, railroads, and pipe and transmission lines.

citeinfo.origin: Spatial Analysis Center- Yellowstone National Park
citeinfo.title: 1999 All Roads in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, Montana, Idaho

srcinfo.srccontr: These road arcs replaced those in the DLGs that covered Yellowstone National Park. Thesse data were GPS'd, therefore their accuracy (sub-meter) is much better than the 1:100,000 DLGs.

citeinfo.origin: Spatial Analysis Center, Yellowstone National Park
citeinfo.title: Boundary of Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, Montana, Idaho

srcinfo.srccontr: This layer was used to clip out the DLGs within Yellowstone National Park so they could be replaced with more accurate data (All Roads of Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, Montana, Idaho).

procstep.procdesc: The west and east side of each 1:100k quad was converted to ARC/INFO using the sdts2cov.aml, using the -layers 1..12-define arguments. The master data dictionary from the USGS was installed.

The append command was used to join the quads together. The border arcs of each tile were deleted by selecting features with entity-label = ' '. The matchnode command was then run, with a match tolerance of 8.0.
The coverage was then built with the line option. In most cases, the arc attribute table needed to be updated to include ALL items used in the GYA, so that all AAT's matched.
A few DLG's had missing attributes. Border arcs in these cases had to be manually deleted.

Route_desc field was added, classifying class 1 roads as "Primary routes," class 2 roads as "Secondary routes," class 3 roads as "Roads or streets," and class 4 roads as "Class 4 Roads or Streets," while other descriptions from the entity_def field remained the same.

Most original fields were dropped (NAME, TYPE, STREET, ROUTE_TYPE, ROUTE_DESCRIP, ARBITRARY_EXT, RELATION_TO_GRO, VERTICAL_RELATI, OPERATIONAL_STA, ACCESS_RESTRICT, OLD_RAILROAD_GR, WITH_RAILROAD, COVERED, HISTORICAL, LIMITED_ACCESS, PHOTOREVISED, LANES, ROAD_WIDTH, BEST_ESTIMATE, ROUTE_TYPE1, ROUTE_TYPE2, ROUTE_TYPE3, ROUTE_TYPE4, COINCIDENT1, COINCIDENT2) due to lack of descriptive data in fields.
In arcedit, those arcs with no attribute information were coded for primary roads only.

cntorgp.cntorg: Spatial Analysis Center - Yellowstone National Park

cntinfo.cntinst: Please check web site first: http://www.nps.gov/yell/technical/gis

procstep.procdesc: Arc features within the Yellowstone National Park Boundary were erased, the Yellowstone roads coverage was placed inside, and the two coverages were merged and edgematched.

overview.eaover: This coverage contains all the default Arc/Info atributes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internal node number for the beginning of an arc (from-node).

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internal node number for the end of an arc (to-node).

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internal node number for the left polygon.

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internal node number for the right polygon.

attrdomv.udom: Whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics ("GIF" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data. The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
